creator: pand6029@artax.karlin.mff.cuni.cz
text:
I have made some experiments with hyphenation in FOP in order to test 
my set of patterns for Czech language. I need to embed font because 
Czech language is not covered by WinAnsiEncoding. And I met some 
strange behavior. When using default fonts (no embedding), hyphenation 
seem to work correctly, even for Czech language, but Czech letters not 
covered by WinAnsiEncoding are replacd by # as expected. When I 
embedded Microsoft's Arial TTF, Czech letters are OK, but hyphenation 
behaves in very strange way in all languages printed using Arial. 
(Notice "J" letter at the end of some lines)

Due to file sizes I am not posting examples of described behavior here. 
I have published them on following place instead:

http://www.ms.mff.cuni.cz/~pand6029/fop/

hyphen.pdf contains correctly hyphenated file without embedded font
hyphemb.pdf contains example of hyphenation with embedded font.

all was made with cvs snapsot of FOP with name xml-
